Package be.kdg.se3.services.railway

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    InfrastructureServiceProxy
    Proxy that simulates a call to the infrastructure service
    The proxy mimics the real HTTP service as close as possible: it is called with a URL and returns JSON
    The URL does not exist and no real HTTP call is made; the proxy holds the calling thread for some millis to simulate network latency
    A call to www.services4se3.com/railway/infrastructure/sections/sectionId will return a JSON with info on the section with the specified id (int)
    The JSON response has the following structure

    {
    sectionId: the id of the section (int) ,
    numberOfBlocks: the number of blocks in this section (int),
    blockLength: the length of the blocks in this section in meter (int) ,
    crossings: this field is only present if there are crossings, it contains a string with the numbers (1=first block) of the blocks in this section that contain a crossing, separated by a - (int-int-int-...) ,
    singleDirection: true if trains can only travel in one direction on this section (boolean) ,
    highBlocknumberSectionIds: this field is only present when singleDirection=false, it contains the section id's (id-id) connected to this one on the side with the high block numbers (int)
    }

    Requested sectionId's are supposed to fall in the range [1-1000]
    The service returns data in realistic ranges, but the data is random generated so subsequent calls with the same id will return in most cases different data
    Some id's do not result in random behaviour:
    - If you use the constructor without params, rideId's 1 to 7 will return a fixed result (with short sections to allow easy testing) - If you use the second constructor, you can supply your own set of sections as a map
    Each sectionid in the map must be coupled to InfrastructureServiceProxy.SectionInfo object
    (supply an empty string if you don't want crossings)
    - sectionId 11 will always raise an IOException to simulate a communication error
    - sectionId's outside the range [1-1000] return an error JSON response (see below) indicating an unknown sectionId
    - sectionId's that can not be converted to a number will return an error JSON response (see below) indicating an invalid sectionId
    - an incorrect URL will raise an IOException

    An error JSON response indicates that the call succeeded but no sensible data could be returned.
    InfrastructureServiceProxy.SectionInfo
